name: The Chester Residence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a wonderful 4 night stay here. Extremely spacious and well equipped "Grand" apartment.
reviews.title: excellent !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had read many reviews on here so was expecting something special and was not disapponted (much) no ,really it is as most people describe . Just a couple of niggles. The sofas looked very stylish but unfortunately the only way to be comfortable on them was to stretch out ,feet up . which is fine except if you want to cuddle up with your loved one ! it was impossible to sit together without getting back ache! that was a shame as we were wanting a romantic time !
reviews.title: Faultless!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other thing was the lack of a cooked breakfast option ,This would have been nice but maybe not manageable given the set up . all in all though quite fabulous and would most highly recommend.
reviews.title: Without doubt an absolute gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: In an excellent position, only a short walk from Prince's Street and the main attractions. These apartments are perfection. Quality, tasteful furnishings and decorated to the highest standards. Rory and his team ensure that everyone is well cared for, welcomed and treated as if they are the only guests there. I would have no hesitation in recommending these apartments to anyone....try them, you won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a two night stay in a Penthouse Apartment (a surprise for my Girlfriend's birthday) and we had a fantastic time - great location, exquisite rooms and exceptional service. From the moment we checked in to the moment we left nothing was too much for the staff. From champagne on arrival (courteousy of the management) to organising taxis, from carrying your luggage to your room even before you've had a chance to check in to having a guest reception with home made cocktails and canapés. These little touches all contributed to a simply wonderful weekend. The apartment itself was fantastic - with the free standing bath and tv in the bathroom a particular highlight. I would recommend The Chester Residence to anyone who wants a little but of luxury whilst in Edinburgh. While the setting and the quality of the apartments sets itself above the rest the quality of service and attention to details is unrivalled. Thanks for a great weekend!
reviews.title: Do not stay anywhere else. Everything you've read is true!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor, and given the extremely positive reviews thought we'd try it out. My wife and I stayed in the penthouse rooms for two nights, and I have to say I was sorry we'd not decided to stay for longer. Whenever we're back in Edinburgh we'll be sure to stay here again.
reviews.title: What a find! That's Edinburgh sorted from now on.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived by train, and from Haymarket station the hotel's a realistic 10-minute walk, something that was fine with wheeled cases. The location is in a quiet, grand street - certainly something pretty impressive on arrival. A nice young doorman immediately led us to the check-in area and took care of our cases, while the girl on reception told us about the hotel and then showed us to our suite. There's no elevator, so view the three flights of stairs as an invitation to indulge in the Edinburgh cuisine.
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite was simply impressive, certainly one of the plushest hotel experiences I've had so far. We had a large bedroom (with large plasma TV), huge bathroom (with double-sized bath and LCD TV in the wall), a good-sized kitchen and a large living room (with enormous plasma TV). So that's three TVs (and a DVD player) in one apartment. Crazy!
reviews.title: Beautiful Property - Service Mixed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately we were only staying for a couple of nights, so didn't have a chance to discover everything that was on offer. The memory-foam pillows or the breakfast choices will have to wait until our next stay. But one thing I did discover is the hotel has a library of around 200 DVD movies that can be freely borrowed. With so few rooms I think the staff get to know the guests, and so things just seem a little more relaxed than at regular hotels. For example, on checkout, the receptionist had remembered all the things we'd told her two days earlier (purpose of stay, where we were going next, etc). I thought that was a nice touch.
reviews.title: A complete pleasure from start to finish!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: In summary, it's unconventional, relaxing, stylish and in a good location. And we can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Owner's Residence (Armani Suite)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Intended to book just a couple of traditional hotel rooms for a half term break with husband and two teenage daughters - so glad I booked here instead! We stayed in one of the mews apartments having looked closely at the various rooms on their website. The mews apartments are a big bigger than the other apartments and my worries about them being dark (being in the basement) were unfounded. The apartment was very spacious, well equipped, stylishly decorated and the staff couldn't have been more helpful with our various and numerous requests. There were two ensuite shower rooms plus another bathroom which we, at first, thought excessive - until we discovered the TV in the bathroom with its floating remote - bliss! We didn't need a car as all the restaurants we went to were within walking distance and getting cabs to and from other places was cheaper than paying for parking. Would definitely rebook this brilliant place if visiting Edinburgh again.
reviews.title: Beats staying in a traditional hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i planned a last min break to the big smoke.Planning on staying in the balmoral we are delighted we changed our minds at the last min.This place is prob the best accom that we have had the pleasure of staying at.This rivals the £1000+ suit at Cameron House which is hard to beat, believe me.The decor is spot on from the leather sofas to the miele appliances the full place is a touch of class.The staff have all been very well trained. They couldn't be nicer or do anything else to make your stay more pleasurable.The lovely lady who cleaned our rooms smiled every min of the day, the lad who carried our bags up 6 floors did it with a smile it all made for a lovely atmophere. PLEASE READ THIS REVIEW. You will not find a beter place in Scotland to stay for the price. I just hope there are rooms available for my next stay in Edinburgh. 12/10
reviews.title: mid week WONDER break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A wonderful welcome from Neil in his cute black kilt set the scene for this remarkable establishment. We viewed the apartments on line, which has the best web site for viewing the rooms. Our apartment was very spacious and modern, with great bathroom and fine Molton Brown bath products. Most evenings Neil or Ian made cocktails for the guests – a great way to mix and meet other travellers. The apartment is a short walk to the main attractions of Edinburgh in a very quiet and delightful Georgian neighbourhood. The only disparaging remark would be the amount one has to pay for parking £25 per day – hardly The Chester Residence fault, but it’s a bit of stinger. We can highly recommend this establishment.
reviews.title: Luxurious Apartments in the heart of Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I just spent a lovely 7day 6 night stay at the chester residences from 29th september 2011 to 5th october 2011.
reviews.title: Surpassed everything we had imagined!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Right from the start we entered the premises, we were won over. After a looong 14hr flight from singapore, we were greeted pleasantly by Neil and everyone. Granted the room was not ready in the wee hrs we arrived, but everyone made it a point to ensure our arrival and check in was as smooth as it can be. We were cheerfully given a tour of the place (oh my! diet cokes galore! and the longue...!!) and were almost in awe when shown our room 9/2. It was even more amazing than what was shown on the website!
reviews.title: This is your Edinburgh Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a few nights this October and had a wonderful time - the service was great, the staff friendly and helpful, and the location was ideal for us (a few minutes from Princes street, a short walk if you're able, and a leisurely 30-minute walk to the castle). While there's a great deal of construction on Princes to build the controversial new trams, making taxi rides and driving a little more complicated, it doesn't take away from this gorgeous city. We chose the Chester Residence based on the ranking from TripAdvisor, so we came expecting something special, and we were not disappointed! The apartment we had on Chester street was very large, the ceilings high, we had a kitchen, private garden and large living room with a sky-light, and furnishings chosen by a keen eye. Literally the only thing I could find wrong with the place, if anything, would be that the plumbing in the en-suite bathroom was a little noisy and the tub would fill a little when flushing the toilet, but considering the age of the building, and the fact that our apartment was lower than street level (but with a great amount of light), it's a very minor issue - we've experienced worse, noisier plumbing in other hotels in the UK. Overall, we found the Chester Residence to be a fantastic experience that is made near-perfect by the accommodating staff - we recommend it wholeheartedly!
reviews.title: One of the best hotels, with the best service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our LARGE serviced apartment in a beautifully restored Georgian townhouse featured a huge high ceilinged sitting room, an equally large bedroom with king bed and comfortable chairs which could be turned to face lovely private gardens, two bathrooms and a well equipped eat in kitchen. We were a five minute walk from the New Town and about a fifteen minute walk from the Old Town. Local buses on nearby Queensferry Street will take you to virtually any place in and around Edinburgh. The Chester is in the West End which is quiet but close to everthing. there are many fine restaurants nearby - or you can eat in and then curl up in front of the warming fireplace.
reviews.title: A Romantic Retreat in Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Caring staff answered all questions and responded to any requests. Our stay was a joy!!
reviews.title: Wow! What an amazing place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend arranged a trip to Edinburgh and a stay at The Chester Residence for my 30th birthday. We only had one night but it was so amazing that i cannot wait to come back.
reviews.title: Above first class!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed in a luxurious penthouse apartment and although all of it was extremely well decorated I could have stayed the whole time in the bathroom with the tv & waterproof remote.
reviews.title: best Hotel

description: The Chester Residence (voted Scottish Hotel of the year at the Scottish Hotel 2012 awards) is a collection of 5 Georgian townhouses set in the stunning west end of Edinburgh. These chic 5 star (Scottish Tourist Board rated) designer suites blend seamlessly with attention to detail and a level of personalized service that ensures guests enjoy the highest standards, synonymous with The Chester Residence. Each suite is an oasis of tranquility, offering spacious, individually designed suites with all the benefits of a luxury hotel. The latest in room technology is provided including, direct-dial telephone, voice mail, wide-screen multi-channel TV, DVD, CD player and iPod docking stations.
